ticket.tag: activerecord activesupport bug edge patch tested
ticket.title: Ruby 1.9 Compat: Redefining object_id and Rational.new!
ticket.original-body:
This patch fixes two Ruby 1.9 compatibility issues:
- Use of Rational.new! in the active_support tzinfo classes, which is a private method in Ruby 1.9
- Inadvertent redefining of object_id in active_record, which yields a scary "This may cause serious issues" in Ruby 1.9
Thanks, Nate
ticket.latest-body:
This patch fixes two Ruby 1.9 compatibility issues:
- Use of Rational.new! in the active_support tzinfo classes, which is a private method in Ruby 1.9
- Inadvertent redefining of object_id in active_record, which yields a scary "This may cause serious issues" in Ruby 1.9
Thanks, Nate
ticket.original-body-html:
This patch fixes two Ruby 1.9 compatibility issues:

  • Use of Rational.new! in the active_support tzinfo classes, which is a private method in Ruby 1.9
  • Inadvertent redefining of object_id in active_record, which yields a scary "This may cause serious issues" in Ruby 1.9

Thanks,

Nate

- Use of Rational.new! in the active_support tzinfo classes, which is a private method in Ruby 1.9
- Inadvertent redefining of object_id in active_record, which yields a scary "This may cause serious issues" in Ruby 1.9

version.body-html:
This patch fixes two Ruby 1.9 compatibility issues:

  • Use of Rational.new! in the active_support tzinfo classes, which is a private method in Ruby 1.9
  • Inadvertent redefining of object_id in active_record, which yields a scary "This may cause serious issues" in Ruby 1.9

version.body: (from [1b0128c5413ace12dee45e9db328cff866a5bb06]) Don't rely on association proxying object_id. [#225 state:resolved] http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/1b0128c5413ace12dee45e9db328cff866a5bb06
